description: The SNMP trap that is generated when a port turns into
forwarding state from other state.

event.Summary: Port is in forwarding state

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpiPortStateForwarding HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpInstanceID i 0 HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpiPortIndex i 9999 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpPwName s EXAMPLE

description: Multiple spanning-tree instance Identifier.
The scope of instance identifier is different,
some versions are 0 to 48.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpInstanceID

description: The index of the bridge port.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpiPortIndex

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifName

description: Pw name
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpPwName

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when a port turns into
discarding state from forwarding state.

event.Summary: Port is in discarded state

some versions are 0 to 48.

receives a superior message on the relevant instance.

tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpiEdgePortChanged HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpiStpPortEdgeport i 1 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpPwName s EXAMPLE
$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpiEdgePortChanged HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpiStpPortEdgeport i 2 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpPwName s EXAMPLE
$SNMPTRAPCMD HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpiEdgePortChanged HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpiStpPortEdgeport i 3 IF-MIB::ifName s EXAMPLE HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpPwName s EXAMPLE

description: Whether the port fast is enabled. By default, there is no configuration on the port.
When the port is the edge port, it can change to forwarding state .
We can set the value. Disable indicates that we make the port not
to be a edge port. Enable indicates that we make the port to be a
edge port. The port's edge port state is same in all instance of MSTP.
When set the value, the hwMstpInstanceID must be 0.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpiStpPortEdgeport

description: The textual name of the interface. The value of this
object should be the name of the interface as assigned by
the local device and should be suitable for use in commands
entered at the device's `console'. This might be a text
name, such as `le0' or a simple port number, such as `1'
depending on the interface naming syntax of the device. If
several entries in the ifTable together represent a single
interface as named by the device, then each will have the
same value of ifName. Note that for an agent which responds
to SNMP queries concerning an interface on some other
(proxied) device, then the value of ifName for such an
interface is the proxied device's local name for it.
If there is no local name, or this object is otherwise not
applicable, then this object contains a zero-length string.

variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpPwName

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when a port turns into
forwarding state from other state in the MSTP process.

event.Summary: Port is in forwarding state

description: The current state of the port in MSTP process.
It must be disabled, discarding, learning or forwarding.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpProPortState

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when a port turns into
discarding state from forwarding state in the MSTP process.

event.Summary: Port is in discarded state

description: The current state of the port in MSTP process.
It must be disabled, discarding, learning or forwarding.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpProPortState

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when the bridge is no longer
the root bridge of the MSTP process Spanning Tree. Another
switch with higher priority has already been the root bridge.

event.Summary: MSTP pro port state: $v1

description: The current state of the port in MSTP process.
It must be disabled, discarding, learning or forwarding.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpProPortState

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when a root-guard port
receives a superior message in the MSTP process.

event.Summary: MSTP pro port root guard state: $v1

description: The current state of the port in MSTP process.
It must be disabled, discarding, learning or forwarding.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpProPortState

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when an edged port of
the BPDU-guard MSTP process receives BPDU packets.

event.Summary: MSTP pro port BPDU guard state: $v1

description: The current state of the port in MSTP process.
It must be disabled, discarding, learning or forwarding.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpProPortState

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when an Alternate-Port
or Root-Port is aged out in the MSTP process.

event.Summary: MSTP pro port loop guard state: $v1

description: The current state of the port in MSTP process.
It must be disabled, discarding, learning or forwarding.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpProPortState

description: When the edged-port receives a BPDU packet, the edged-port attribute will be disabled.
Then the SNMP trap is generated.

event.Summary: Edge port status: $v1

description: Whether the port fast is enabled in the MSTP process. When the
port is the edge port, it can change to forwarding state immediately.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpProPortStpEdgeport

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when an MSTP instance receive TC BPDUs' number
exceeds the threshold.

event.Summary: MSTP instance TC BPDUs exceeded threshold

description: The Bridge Priority for the spanning tree instance
identified by MSTID. Step of 4096.For example
we can set the Priority of the bridge such as 0, 4096, 8192 etc.
It can be used to determined whether the bridge is the root of
the spanning tree.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpiBridgePriority

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when an MSTP process receive TC BPDUs' number
exceeds the threshold.
Whether the TC protection function is enabled on the MSTP process.
If the function is enabled, the TC message exceeded threshold will
be defered to deal with at the end of TC protection time.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpProTcGuard

description: The Bridge Priority for the spanning tree instance
identified by MSTID. Step of 4096.For example
we can set the Priority of the bridge such as 0, 4096, 8192 etc.
It can be used to determined whether the bridge is the root of
the spanning tree.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpProInstanceBridgePriority

description: The SNMP trap that is generated when the root bridge of
an instance of a MSTP process changed

event.Summary: Root bridge changed

description: The root port for the spanning tree instance identified by the MSTID.
variables.name: HUAWEI-MSTP-MIB::hwMstpProInstanceRootPort

description: Specify that the status of the port STP becomes Forwarding in MSTP process.

event.Summary: Port is in forwarding state
